cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mid-Texas coast between Port O'Connor and Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, including the middle Texas coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40-50 mph) possible late Friday through Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of roughly 2–4 ft possible in and around Matagorda Bay and nearby coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches; flash-flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot operations.
